alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Crockett; Dyer; Fayette; Gibson; Haywood; Henry; Lake; Lauderdale; Madison; Obion; Shelby; Tipton; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 05 at 7:25PM CDT until July 06 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 10 PM CDT WEDNESDAY... ...HEAT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM WEDNESDAY TO 9 PM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values above to 110 expected. For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 110. * WHERE...Portions of North Mississippi, West Tennessee and East Arkansas. * WHEN...For the Excessive Heat Warning, from 5 AM to 10 PM CDT Wednesday. For the first Heat Advisory, from 10 PM Wednesday to 9 PM CDT Thursday. For the second Heat Advisory, until 5 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
